37949181.review:
Love at First Sight is a kinetic visual novel, and thus you are presented with a linear story without branching narratives or choices. Its focal point, our single eyed Sachi, makes for a very cute VN, and her whole character was adorable. Even with a single large eye she was able to melt my heart. However, the weak writing made for a rocky read.

The art in this game is a little hit or miss, with the best sprites and CG going to Sachi (of course). The sprites for other characters felt lackluster or had proportional errors which made them look a little strange or stiff. The one thing I think the art does well is capture the tone of the surroundings, which is not something VNs focus on. The sprites come off as dark and a little dull looking, using lots of grey tones, but as the story's mood shifts these sprites begin to warm up with brighter colours to complement feelings such as happiness. It's a really nice touch, and blended the art style together with the backgrounds and emotions the story was trying to convey. Furthermore, this VN has really nice background music, and sometimes it was pleasant to just let it loop. I definitely think this is one of the VN's strongest traits, as the tracks could shift between scenes but never felt boring to listen to.

Concerning the writing, the game was free of spelling or grammar errors, and the characters were written with mostly distinct voices, which become apparent later on in the game as there are some POV changes. However, despite all the good things I've said so far, this game has weaker writing. This is explained in the author's afterword as due to the fact the game was rushed, and I think it shows in the game. Characters don't get fleshed beyond what we're presented with except for Sachi, and a lot of the development between Sachi and Mamoru kind of just happens, rather than a good steady progression of their relationship. Of course, with a game focusing on our one eyed heroine, Sachi would get the most development, but even then it is not done in a natural or satisfactory way, and her arc (which coincides with the antagonist's arc) ends in a rather anticlimactic tone. The good things I can say concerning the writing were the changes in POV, giving us insight to several characters, and tidbits of characters doing things that indicate depth to them (but as stated earlier, it's never expanded upon).

What drew me to this game initially was the heroine, but aside from a few mentions of her eye it doesn't really come up much and doesn't seem like much of an impediment to her. I would have thought she would have been tormented and hated the single eye she had, but she doesn't really get bullied over that so why is her eye not a stronger trait in the story? I feel like this was a critical piece of writing that should have been included into the plot.

Every way I look, I just see a lot of missed potential. Sachi is great as a character, but if the writing had been stronger and the characters had more depth, this game could have been fantastic. I want to love this game, I really, [i]really[/i] do because Sachi is absolutely precious, but I cannot recommend this game, especially for the high price it's asking for. The game, aside from being a short play at around 3 hours, offers nothing beyond mediocre writing and characterization, which is unfortunate. I would like to see the dev go back and polish this game or add something new, because I think an overhaul of this game could make it well worth the $10 price. If you still wish to support the dev, I recommend getting this game on sale.

37797682.review:
一开始我是接触了Teaching Feeling（以下简称“TF”），被那奇异却又迷人的画风吸引，慢慢开始了解作者RayK。怎么说呢，她的画风就像榴莲（原谅我这个不恰当的比喻），喜欢的人觉得魅力无穷、赏心悦目，不喜欢的人则觉得画风很恐怖、鬼畜，各有所好，不好评价。

当然，一款游戏不能只靠画风，这款游戏的剧情也无可挑剔（个人意见）。虽然[b]整个游戏只有一条路线[/b]，[spoiler]但是作者在后记里提到过这个游戏是在参加什么展会前的一个月赶制出来的，如果时间能充裕一点她就可以做几个分支。[/spoiler]但是情节还是非常棒的。我一直对作者的编剧能力非常赞叹，无论是TF还是Love at First Sight（以下称独目钟情[spoiler]我还挺喜欢这个译名的[/spoiler]）,题材很普通，但总是能散发出不一样的魅力。

然后就是游戏的主题。无论是TF还是独目钟情，亦或是那部存在性有待考察的“Butterfly Affection”，作者一直在宣扬“救赎”这一主题，尽管她画的人物都不能符合大众所说的“正常”的标准，但玩家都不会把她们当作怪物，甚至为她们付出真心。[spoiler]作者在Twitter上（或者Pixiv，我不太记得了）说过“喜欢恐怖又可爱的生物”，可是我一点都不觉得可怕啊，好失败啊（笑[/spoiler]

买这个游戏我多少还是抱着点补票的心理，玩了两年盗版的TF，想买但是找不到梯子[spoiler]而且我对搭梯子买TF这事有点抵触[/spoiler]，只能在Steam买下这款游戏以表心意，但这只是个开始，如果TF在Steam上发售，不打折我都要买，就算只有日语版我也要买，不在Steam上发售我就以后出国去日本的时候买。

If you are an English-speaker,to summarize,what I said before is:if you're interested in visual novel and bishōjo,you can buy it.

ニッチなジャンル「単眼娘」を題材にした希少な(唯一の？)恋愛アドベンチャー。
本編は二時間もあればクリアできる程度のもので選択肢も無く一本道ですが、単眼娘好きはもちろん不幸属性の女の子に優しくしてあげたい紳士淑女の皆さんにはぜひオススメ。ゲーム自体は単純な紙芝居ものですが、製作者さんの個性的ながらも可愛い女の子のイラストと、優しいお話は価格に対しては十分な出来だと思います。また個人的には各章冒頭の短いアニメーションの可愛さがたまりません。
pixiv時代からヒロインの幸ちゃんを応援してきた身としては感無量。元々コミティアで頒布されたものを買ってプレイしていましたが、ついついこちらでも買ってしまいました。明美(主人公の友人)の立ち絵など、細部で変更があったのかな？　コミティア版の記憶が曖昧ですが、ちょっとだけ立ち絵などの修正は入っているかもですね。本来は選択肢による分岐などの構想もあったそうなので、いつか「完全版」も遊んでみたいと思います。

36586376.review:
Hello, FRiends!  

This is my first time reading a kinetic novel! (As opposed to otome.) Also, my first time as a male character wooing a girl. And you know what? It was wonderful!

[h1]The Wonderful[/h1]
[list]
    [*]The one-eyed girl, Sachi, is adorable!  So many cute moments!  There's a scene[spoiler]while she's being fed,[/spoiler] when she blushes and scrunches up her eye, that made my tummy do little flip-flops!  It makes you want to playfully tease her a bit more just to get those adorable reactions.  Her learning how to smile and trust is absolutely heart warming. 
    [*]Though she does have social problems, it's not so much based on her appearance.  Even her bully[spoiler]just despises aspects of her personality.[/spoiler]She has problems even a two-eyed girl might have, which makes it relatable.
    [*]The art is lovely. I'd call it quirky.  Refreshing to look at.
    [*]All characters have fleshed-out personalities. (I want to know MC's friends!)
    [*]It's not a heavy story--more like a fairy tale.  Though I admit, first seeing her and her wounds/bandages is alarming.  You can see those for yourself on the store page before you buy.
    [*]The English is flawless.
[/list]

[h1]The Not so Wonderful[/h1]
[list]
     [*]Short!  Finished in 3.5 hours.  As cute as it is, there's no way I'd wanna pay $9.99 for this--it's just too short.  I got it for $2.49 at 75% off which was a steal!  I wouldn't pay more than 5 bucks for it.
[/list]

[h1]...And the Weird[/h1]
[list]
     [*](mild spoiler)[spoiler]There's a plot device where the MC touches her wounds and scars to become more physically intimate.  It kinda reads like a sexual encounter...without the sex.  I felt like I was watching somebody's kink.  Not horrible--just odd.[/spoiler]
     [*]There's an author's section where the creator apologizes for the shortness and quality.  That's the whole topic.  Apparently, she was rushed to meet a deadline to paticipate in some project. (Maybe a convention?)  It's a bit bizarre to include an author's not-so-short apology for the game you just purchased.  
[/list]

[h1]The Verdict[/h1]
     I can't recommend this visual novel enough.  If you like cute, sweet, and sentimental--without breaking your heart--this is the game for you. Just don't pay full price.

Что ж, вы дошли до моей субъективной оценки,  которую я косвенно осветил в начале. 
Сюжет - прост как болт, вам не придётся ломать голову. Скорее даже мозг от подобного отдохнет. Хотя... Если рассматривать не историю в рассказе, а историю создания, то  будет достаточно интересно. 
Музыкальное сопровождение - простое, симпатичное, надоедливое. Извиняюсь за такое сравнение, но у меня этот аспект вызывает ассоциацию с пушистым котом, который пытается ненавязчиво залезть к вам на клавиатуру.
Персонажи - обыкновенные стереотипы, даже более того - плохо выраженные. За ними не интересно наблюдать, от них не ждёшь даже намёка на эмоцию, для тебя просто существуют. Но есть одно весомое но - взаимоотношения с одноглазкой, вытягивающей картину. Это что-то личное, застенчивое, романтичное. Есть огрехи ( реальность гораздо богаче на последствия подобной помощи), однако работает, справляется со своей задачей завлечь в игру на недолгий срок. 
Графика - стабильная 4. Да, я не шучу, действительно понравилось. Хотя уж тут скорее выдержанный стиль, соблюдающий определенные пропорции. 
Фетиши - прибавился ещё один, который ну никак не мог предугадать! Спасибо создателю за идею.
Отдельно хочу сказать о достижениях с бонусами. Первое зарабатывается легко, так что вот вам ещё одна пройденная на 100% игра в копилку. А второе просто даст свежий глоток, оставит приятное послевкусие. На этом практически всё. 
P.s. Делал весь проект один человек, так что пускай его следующий проект станет лучше.

This game isn't necessarily bad, it just isn't that great, and is pretty uninspired in my opinion. 

I bought this game when it was on sale for $3, at that price, I would say it was worth it. The story was cute, if a bit short, and it was generally entertaining, but for it's regular price of $10...it's definately not worth your money. There are at least half a dozen VN's on Steam that I could recommend for the same price or less with better art, better story, longer play time, etc. 

I think it's kind of sad that this game turned out the way it did, because I really do think that it had potential, but even the author admits that the game was rushed and was lacking in several departments. Had the art been cleaned up a bit, included some different routes, and just been given some more depth to the story, this could have been a great game, but as it stands, it's just an interesting and unique concept that didn't move far beyond that.

Unless you're super into monster girl stories, like the anime meets Tim Burton art style, or you have an injured girl/scars fetish (The author's words, not mine), then you might enjoy Love at First Sight, everyone else should just move along.

34543774.review:
[quote=author]A pure, heart-warming romance game where the apple of your eye only has one eye![/quote]

[b]Is it a game?[/b] Not really. There are nothing that you need to do, no choices you need to make, all you have is a story to read. This is not a game, but a short visual novel for you to waste a little time on.

[b]Is it a good story?[/b] Yes, if you wish to see a short, sweet story of "something popped out of a fairytale" then i say go for it. The story give me a vibe of [url=https://www.katawa-shoujo.com/]Katawa Shoujo[/url] as well (for obvious reasons).

[b]How would i describe my experience reading this?[/b] The story is nowhere near perfect, that much is certain. Certain parts feel rushed and you can see the VN potential of being something greater had it the time to be polished. The author explained this issue in the VN itself, but here the short version:
[spoiler]This is the author first attempt at making something in a game/VN format. The author is a Japanese living in America, and their English is not great. They only have about two months to work on this project before barely turn in before the deadline for Comitia, not to mention being mostly a one person project (they only had help with the soundtrack). Due to time constraint, the VN's full potential of being a full-fledged "game" was gone. This finished product only feature one path where the main character woo our cyclops. Should you search up the author and his artworks, there are pieces that indicate the VN to having multiple pathways with multiple "unique" girls to interact and potentially romanced. Sadly, all of these features are scrapped, and the author was not happy with the result.[/spoiler]

[b]Should you buy it?[/b] Admittedly, the game is not worth the $10 price tag only because the missed potential that it could be. My recommendation is to wait for a Sale and purchase it for some feel-good reading session. Such as when i let it sit in my Wish List for over a year (mostly because i forgot) until i saw a 70% Sale. Got it for $3.

34432533.review:
Rating: 7/10 ("Good")

Recommended for: People who enjoy VNs, people who enjoy romance. I would not recommend this to a first time VN reader.

Love at First Sight is a bit of a tricky visual novel to review. Let's start with the good and neutral parts.

The artwork is its main selling point. While it could be considered amateurish, it has a lot of charm and I like it a lot. The backgrounds, CGs, and character sprites all have a similar quality to them that make them pleasing to the eye. The soundtrack is, at best, adequate. The story is told in multiple short "Acts" that have a small animation utilizing a CG or scene from the previous "Act". There are no choices to make throughout the story.

Love at First Sight's plot is very cute and heartwarming, and has a lovely message and overall theme. It was an enjoyable read despite its somewhat strange subject matter, which is the primary reason I don't consider this a good pick for new visual novel readers. The characters were also a joy to read about even if they didn't have a lot of depth.

But..and this is an enormous but...Love at First Sight just isn't worth the price, whether it's the full one ($11 CAD) or on sale.

The primary reason for this is that the story just isn't very memorable. Sure, it's sugary sweet and more slice of life than anything, but the only thing you'll really remember about this story is that the heroine is a cyclops. Other than that, it is quite similar to other tales of its ilk, and I could predict the "twists" that came with it.

In addition, I read the novel in just about 2 hours, which feels too short for the price, especially full price, and [i]especially[/i] when more memorable visual novels are available for [i]free[/i] (see CUPID).

So, despite the fact that I honestly consider this novel to be "good", I really can't justify the price, and can't justify a "recommendation". Of course, feel free to snatch it up and read it when it's on sale, but don't go buying it at full price. You'll likely feel disappointed.

Now I feel bad for marking this "not recommended". Oh well.

33530196.review:
This is a qualified recommendation; I wouldn't buy this game, unless it is on sale.

Anyway, this a short, sweet and simple game that does what it sets out to do in telling a sweet and simple story. A puddle of chocolate, with a side order of touching angst; the heroine is for better or worst a most troubled and sympathetic woobie, which is the main draw of the game. If you want to vicariously rescue a tragic and unhappy one-eyed schoolgirl step right up.

When I said simple and short, I really meant that. The game has the simplest backstory, though side characters are decent, and I've heard some praise the hero for being active; perhaps that's why the game ends so quickly. Too quickly, and far too suddenly; any good ending should look forward somewhat into its characters' futures, which this game does not do. But apart from that, what little the game sets out to do, it does.

32788315.review:
In [i]Love at First Sight[/i] you play as a second year Japanese high school student named Mamoru. Only a couple of months ago he had to transfer to a new school, but he has already found good friends in Tomoyori and Akemi. However, he meets a strange girl a year below him, named Sachi, in a hallway. She is strange in that she is a cyclops; she has only a single, large eye. In addition, he sees that she looks injured or beaten up as she is covered in wounds and wears tattered clothing. She does not have any friends, but Mamoru decides to be nice and spend time around her.

This game is a kinetic novel, a type of visual novel with no branching story lines and only one ending. It can be played through as fast as the player can read it. I would estimate that it would take the average person around two or two-and-a-half hours to get through the whole thing.

To start off with a positive aspect of this game, I thought the artwork was fairly good. It manages to be a pleasing combination between cute and creepy at the same time. The colors used in the game are more on the darker side giving it a kind of creepy feeling, but the design of the characters is rather cute in contrast.

Unfortunately, most other aspects do not work well. The writing and characters are always the most important parts of any visual novel and the quality of them in [i]Love at First Sight[/i] is very mediocre. All of the characters in this game are incredibly two-dimensional and types of clichés that we have all seen before. You have the protagonist who is little more than an empty shell nice guy self-insert for the player, Sachi who is the shy and lonely character you help, Akemi who is the one bubbling with energy, Rui who is a standard fare school bully, and so on. It is especially annoying when none of these characters are ever fleshed out. This is very true with Rui as she comes off as the most clichéd type of bully imaginable who is angry all the time for no real reason. The Sachi character really should have been developed more considering the whole quirk of the game is her character. Aside from her appearance, her unique characteristic of being a cyclops has almost no bearing on the story at all. She could have been depicted as a normal person with two eyes and the exact same character traits and the story could have played out the same. It is just a major disappointment to not see this aspect used at all.

And that brings me to the other major problem with the game: the story. All in all, it is a very predictable high school romance story. The player-character meets a cute girl, they spend time together, go on dates, and be happy. I really do not think I am spoiling anything here. Nothing of substance happens in the story. There are no plot twists, no major developments. Even considering the short length of the game, this was a chore to complete.

Alas, even the music itself is not that great. It quickly became repetitive and irritating.

There is one other aspect that I must comment on. In the bonus content that is unlocked after completing the game, the creator is pretty open about the fact that some of his fetishes (he mentions eating and scars) made their way into the game. A few scenes in the game depict Mamoru touching Sachi's various scars which was awkward enough during play, but knowing the creator's intentions just gives the scenes even more negative connotations. Is it really necessary to depict a girl with injuries just to satisfy some weird fetish? This type of writing is really inexcusable and should have been left out.

Overall, this game is a disappointment. Though the artwork is pretty good, the other major aspects of this game totally failed with a boring and predictable story and clichéd and forgettable characters. This game is definitely not worth the full asking price of $9.99. I bought it 75% off during the summer sale and I am not sure if it is even worth that considering the short length. I am honestly not sure whom I would recommend this to other than maybe visual novel fanatics who want a cheap game on sale.

31857176.review:
While as stated by other reviewers that the length of this kinetic visual novel is indeed short. It wasnt really bug me much since I have played a visual novel far shorter, shallower story written compared to this one.

As an intro, the story is about how MC stumbled upon a mysterious one-eyed student girl, who's crying alone by herself with scars & injuries marked all over her body, only to be revealed later that she's become a victim of bully. And of course as a MC, white knight role is his priority to be uphold. As the story progress, romantic relationship developed between them, heartwarming & cute scenes come into their everyday lives.

There are several subjects that can actually be expanded & explained more (the game developer said himself it was a bit of rushed due to time factor) such as the bully's background story, MC's friends & the girl's relatives which I felt not satisfying enough. According to someone in discussion board, a sequel is in progress.. so yeah, will looking forward to find out the answers in the next installment, hopefully.

Overall, it's still nice & enjoyable for a simple audience, my advise is, purchase it on discount price, give less expectation & you are good to go. (But of course my review alone is not enough to give clearer view about this game, try refer as many reviews out there before you make decision)

And yes, despite her look, this one-eyed girl is harmless & adorable. Must protect :')

This is a kinetic visual novel, but I didn't mind much because it's SUPER F*CKING CUTE!

Like, seriously, this silly, little VN made me smile a bunch because it was just too adorable. It's a simple, but unique story. It's about a cyclops girl in her first year of high school in Japan who is brutally bullied by a classmate until she meets the main character. Over time, the cyclops girl and the main character develop feelings for each other and they're super cute about it. It's a very charming story and I really enjoyed it.

The artwork has an interesting style, and there are cute, little animations that happen between chapters. The Extras section of the menu is really cool. It features commentary from the developer and also additional scenes that happen after the main story has ended. There's also nifty additional art from the developer. 

I definitely recommend such an adorable VN!

30305762.review:
A short novel with an engaging main character who catches the protagonist's eyes one day when she is crying in the stairwell. A tad incomplete in spaces, but all in all a beautiful read and a satisfying conclusion to her bullying and other issues. Hints that this relationship will stand for a long time.

The main character's most obvious feature is an interesting way to tell a tale about how differences on the outside do not really matter compared to what is on the inside. In some ways, Sachi reminds me of Hanako from Katawa Shoujo or Aeka from Yume Miru Kusuri (though without the sheer hell that Aeka goes through... or the extremely satisfying way she snaps at her bully in the end [which was so deserved; seriously what that bully attempted...]).

I have to recommend this for any romantics out there. Or for that matter romance readers (it seriously is in the vein of some of the sweeter ones).

29970683.review:
(MIGHT CONTAIN SPOILERS) 

I want my own Sachi.

It's a cute story. I like how the main character (Mamoru) is just genuinely interested in our one-eyed heroine. Sure, he was surprised -- like any normal human being would. But then he wasn't weirded it out by it and was kind of like your average guy falling slowly in love. I like, love, adore his friend, Tomoyuki because he's so tsundere and smart. The dialog he shared with Mamoru is (to me) really well thought, and felt like they had been friends for a long time. It might be a bad thing though, because our MC had just known him for 2 months but they could already share thoughts, in a way. 

As what the author explained at the end of the game, this game could've been better if there was more time. So I was left a bit unsatisfied when it ended because it felt short. Still, it was a sweet journey with a very ... funny, interesting fetish put on. The EP you unlocked later on that talked about those fetishes are very cute too. I'm not into that but I can appreciate and wish happiness to the couple for sharing such ... ideals.

The negative notes I have about this game is how easily the conflict between the bully is solved (then again, time was limited for this game to be made), and Akemi's character isn't my best friend type. I think I relate more with Tomo and I can't stand overly energetic people but, hey, as a manga / fictional character, she works. She falls into that archetype so this is just preference issue, is all. 

That said, I really wished that the author makes updates to add to the game to make it better and add more archs that was claimed to have been cut due to time.

OVERALL: Don't expect much from this "rushed" game. Think of it as a light read that you can pick as you're waiting for another game to load. Very casual, one-route game, no choice-making, literally visual novel game with interesting cast.

"Love at First Sight" Is a rather straightforward visual novel. Boy meets girl, girls bullied, they go through the stages of being friends and then romance. The charicters are well written, the art is well done save for a small lack of detail in a few scenes. The music fits rather well to boot. For a game made in two months due to procrastination and a deadline I think this speaks to about 98% of the clients playing it. It's a very good game with the amount of time it took to build it. Though I would love to see a patch where it adds all the things the author intended to be in the final cut.
For 10 dollars and the slightly short 3 hour playtime it's overpriced. Get it on sale but not for more than 50%. The creator disirves credit for all his work.

All in all you get a game with an engaging story and very well writing charicters. Though sad to say it has a lack of the common branching story line so its more like your reading a manga than playing a true visual novel. 29147634.review:
[b]Туранга Лила. Мультипаспорт.[/b]

[i]Жил да был Фукунага Маморо. Замкнутый, необщительный и достаточно язвительный молодой человек, который старался не привлекать к себе внимания, ну а хобби его было весьма необычно – он преследовал одноглазую девушку с целью полюбить. Поначалу он дарил девушке подарки, кормил с рук, а затем начал трогать её многочисленные шрамы и говорить какая она милая и, скорей всего, глупо хихикать при этом… Вот честно, не этого я ожидал от данной игры. Ой, не этого.[/i]

Да, признаюсь, вступительное слово звучит крайне отталкивающе и те люди, что пишут восторженные оды, в адрес этой графической новеллы, могут возразить: «Ты все не так понял, это про любовь!» Возразить то можно всякое, вот только любви тут нет. Есть лишь нездоровые фетиши разработчика, кои он вынес на широкое обозрение. Фетиши, связанный с большими, очень большими глазами и шрамами. При этом он не пытается как-то завуалировать или отвлечь геймера от всего этого. Нас просто ставят перед фактом – у девочки, Усуи Сачи, один огромный глаз в пол лица, отсутствие носа и многочисленные шрамы по всему телу. Как и почему это произошло – не сообщается. Приведет ли это к неожиданному сюжетному повороту? Нет. Будет ли на этом акцентироваться внимание игрока? Постоянно. Опять же, можно возразить, дескать японцы любят все гипертрофировать, что их логика не похожа на нашу и прочее в том же духе. Конечно же, можно сказать что угодно, но правда в том, что подобный ход нельзя спрятать «под ковер» и сказать – ой, она плачет потому что не такая как все. А то что об этой девочке не судачит весь город и главный герой о ней услышал лишь тогда, когда столкнулся нос к носу это как бы не котируется. Про любовь ведь.

Ладно, хорошо, про любовь. Сосредоточим внимание на героях истории. Кто у нас есть? Клишированные донельзя образы – меланхоличный лучший друг героя, гиперактивная подруга, одноглазая девочка-стесняшка, школьная забияка и суровая тетя, которая пережила душевную травму потому она такая суровая. Ну прямо суповой набор. Не то чтобы это плохо, просто характеры именно что обозначены и сами персонажи говорят о себе – я плохой, я стеснительный, я злая. Обычно это сопровождается попыткой подтвердить это некими действиями, но подобное вызывает разве что скуку. Герои получились пустыми и они не вызывают той душевной отдачи, которую должны. Отсюда и история про любовь, что трещит по швам от странного, а порой и вовсе ненормального поведения главного героя, не захватывает. Играешь разве что на автомате, даже не затем, чтобы узнать чем дело закончится, финал угадывается задолго до этого, а просто потому что уже начал играть, не бросать же на полпути?

Итог? Графическая новелла, которая не способна заинтриговать и удержать внимание, даже несмотря на свою малую продолжительность. Единственное, что в ней есть, так это нездоровый фетиш на шрамы, который у автора сих строк вызвал отвращение. И ладно бы это было показано лишь единожды, но трижды! Нет, спасибо, я лучше пойду и поиграю во что-нибудь светлое, доброе, вечное. В «Witcher 3», к примеру. Там хоть не предлагают дотронуться до чужих шрамов… Wait! Oh shi~

3 из 10 фетишей

28930878.review:
I didn't think I'd like this game as much as I do. I don't know why I like it so much, but it's currently my favorite VN (not that I've played a lot).

The story is a really cute romance, with a nice, "creepy-cute" style, and some weird romantic parts thrown in to match that, but it's very enjoyable. There's nothing ecchi, so people won't think you're a pervert for liking an anime cyclops. Sachi is, of course, really cute. Play the game for her. <3

It's pretty short and progresses quickly, which could be seen as a con, but I like that. I can play a little bit at a time before bed and not take weeks.

The protagonist is a lot more relatable to me than other games' characters, so it's easy to read without jarring interuptions of unnatural dialogue and unnecessary narration, beside just being a dense tool. Seriously, Mamoru (lit. "to protect") is a very nice guy. I'd be friends with him.

Having both English and Japanese options is really great. I'm going to use it to practice my Japanese in a fun way.

28778667.review:
ノベルゲーム。
主人公 福永護が単眼少女 臼井幸 にひと目惚れするところから始まるラブストーリーだ。単眼少女 臼井幸というキャラクターありきで作られたビジュアルノベルで選択肢はない。
開発経緯を全く知らなかった私にとってこのゲームを最初にプレイした印象は、単眼少女というのは身体上のなんらかの問題を抱えた少女を隠喩した表現で、インパクトを狙って付けられた設定、恋愛モノのひと目惚れに掛けて作られたとばかり思っていた。実際は違っていた。しかし、単眼少女をそのように置き換えても話の流れとしては何ら問題はない。傷だらけ(と傷フェチ)の設定は少し引っかかるが、割とオーソドックスな展開の恋愛話だ。

ありふれた話の流れではあるが、全体的に好意に溢れていて暖かい気持ちになれる良いノベルだと思う。残念なのはラストだ。話としては完結しているが余韻があまりないように思える。スタッフクレジットのBGMが他の場面で普通に使われてそうなものだったことで、ラストに唐突さもある。
それでも、丁寧にまとめられていることが感じられ、このゲームの最大の特徴である単眼少女というインパクトもある。単眼少女の眼力に惹き込まれたら、読んでみることをオススメする。

28703726.review:
Let's start my rating for this game 6.8/10

Negitives:
  -  Generic/predictable story that rushed through some parts too quickly
  -  I suffered one game crash in my first 3 1/2 hours of game time making me play from a save from 20 minutes prior
  -  Black screens you need to click through
  -  The GUI was inconsistent within itself
  -  The music was repetitive and it wasn't unusual to loop through a track multiple times in one scene
  -  I had a few "who wrote this?" moments where dialog was awkward or an event that didn't make sense
  -  No dialog options
  -  One of the achievements requires you to play through the game in Japanese

Positives
 + Story was pretty cute
 + The artwork was incredible charming

First things first, this game is not worth ten dollars, if it's on sell then it's worth it, it's really good, cute, heartwarming, and overall a good experience, though it's a kinetic novel (which means there's zero choices in the game) it still felt like a proper VN.

The fetishes that are very clearly displayed, didn't feel intrusive and were overall cute and endearing, if you're okay with a scar, feeding others your own food, and your girl getting punched (there is no actual scene of her getting punched but it was in dialog and it wasn't in a sexual way either) fetishes then this will be just fine for you too as it was for me.

Now onto what it's about.
You're just some dude who meets this cyclops girl and she's cute and you fell in love with her at first sight of course, if you can't tell that from the name and pictures then you must be some kind of airhead, like a certain character from this game.

Now the flaws.
1. The music can be pretty bad at times though intentionally, I know this will be annoying to others but I was fine with it since I knew it was trying to portray a sort of off kilter and creepy (not scary creepy) vibe.

2. The little cinemas where they tell you what act you're on are tween animated (look it up) though it's not too bad at times, at other times it makes me want to die a little since it's kinda cringy.

3. No choices, this really sucked since I wanted a route without the fetish parts so the ending would have them be less close (Neutral end), a route where you'd abuse her yourself (bad end), or even a route where she's a masochist and you're a sadist or something (true end perhaps) since she did seem like the masochist type.

[b]Overall I loved it and it tugged on my weeaboo heart strings but it's only worth it if it's under six dollars.[/b]

[h1]Graphics are noticeable, narration results a bit monocled.[/h1]

I do not recommend this game as in my opinion it is lacking content and some events are resulting slightly rushed.
Dialogues result too simple, characters are actually nice but lack personality and seem to be pushed forcibly in the story.

The story is a generic romantic encounter between a boy and a... wait wha, a cyclops...!
Besides the plot lacking events, what seemed out of place in this game to me is how plain our main heroine is presented; a silent non reactive shy girl having a single eye (with no utter explanation to it, nor affecting particularly the main story) being bullied. After -obviously- getting noticed by senpai, she starts opening up bit by bit, et cetera, et cetera.
So the only "particular" trait of her would be her eye and wounds presented upon her sprites which lack background story.

I am not understating the developer's work and time put in this game. Actually, the art is quite interesting and particular (mostly appreciated the background art!), music is just right at the point. 
[i]What makes this game too ordinary is not the fact of it being a Kinetic Novel.[/i]
It may need some retouches as the developer noticed themselves, but its basics might create a good starting point.
I purchased Hitomebore during sales and honestly if I were to pay 10$ for this game I'd end up being disappointed.

27854592.review:
爱，是什么呢？你相信一见钟情吗？
我反正是相信的。
诚然，时间是在爱情实践中必不可少的要素。但是那种一见钟情的灵感瞬间，正是燎原的星星之火。
特别是，坐在天台楼梯间的那个少女，只有一只眼睛。
只有一只巨大的眼睛，长在她的额头正下方。
这无疑是一种缺陷。
那是你看见她一瞬间之内就立马明白的事。
但还有一些事你要一点时间才能明白，她因为她的缺陷而痛苦不堪。她可能也对生活抱有很多幻想，但却微妙的明白她的幻想不可能成为真实。她可能经常会哭。然后你隐约意识到，她所遭遇的隔离和偏见是不公平的，为了公平起见，你想去带她认识真正美好的世界应该有的模样，生活应该如何。还有一个人应该如何坚强。
剩下来的事情啊，你要用更多的时间才会明白了。
你想到自己，你想到自己的失意与幻灭，你想到自己的软弱与缺陷。
越是想到这些，你就越想拉起她的手，帮她站起来。越是想到这些，你就越是感到她的痛苦的深刻。你越是感到，你和她，在外表上是多么不同，而在灵魂上是多么相似啊。 
而外表上的不同无关紧要，重要的是你充分意识到，她和你是同一族类，她和你是相似的人。
她是可爱的人。这是你最后意识到的事。
然后就只有爱有关系了。
所以你喜欢抚摸她手上的伤痕，就好像抚摸着自己手上的伤痕。
所以你在无意中戳到她的痛处的时候，其实你自己的内心比她还要痛苦。
什么是爱？
这就是爱。

27716656.review:
Although in his message within the Extras, the author claims he had to cut a lot of ideas for time and that he's disappointed with the final product, I feel as though it is perfect just the way it is. The short run time makes it less intimidating than some other visual novels, which - between a million characters, branching paths, and different endings - can be a bit overwhelming, especially if all I want to do is relax. This game is not only soothing and heartwarming, it's also very sincere in its depiction of personal issues, from bullying to poor communication within a family. The characters were charming, the art style unique (a refreshing blend of dark yet whimsical), and the background music hit that sweet spot of good but not distracting.
If you're looking for something easy to get into but hard to put down, this is the title that will sate you, and you won't have to feel guilty if you end up playing the whole thing in one sitting.
In my opinion, a perfect kinetic novel.

25473039.review:
This is one of those times where the reviewer starts off with letting you know that they don't fully recommend a "game". I recommend it, but it is so short and fairly empty to where I cannot recommend it while it is $10. A decent sale makes it worth it for me. Also, this review will not use what I consider spoilers (which I use fairly broadly), since I know how big of a deal hearing something in context and for the first time can be. This review uses impressions and general statements of the product.

The story is good, and I found myself caring for some of the characters. The character develpment (what I consider the most essential part to a story) is good, but is quite rushed. There are only a few real characters in the story, and the world feels fairly emtpy outside of their thoughts and interactions with each other. They don't all have much direct explanation of their backgrounds, with most development coming from a scenic style of writing. For those who are pretentious enough, or unfortunate enough to know what that means, you know that its where the characters primarily express themselves through the context of a scene. This lets you read into their character from their direct parts, rather than necessarily just being told what to think. There are parts where they will tell you mostly of how to think of the characters, but the real thing is that there doesn't seem to be a world that the characters are in, rather some inconceivable void past the tinges of a world at the edges of your vision.

After all fo the halabaloo, it has good writing, but not much of it. I would recommend purchasing it for the sensations it brings, and supporting the writer.

Overall, Love at First Sight is a very good dose of meet cute. The artwork is quite nice, blending elements that wouldn't be out of place in a horror game (gloomy color palette,  sagging eyes, etc.) with typical visual novel trappings (huge eyes--or rather, eye, effusive poses, and a surprising amount of moe).

Those seeking a particularly deep story should probably go elsewhere. While LaFS is very, very cute and can bring the feels when needed, at the end of it all it's nothing more than (particularly sweet) fluff. 

LaFS is also very short. While I am a quick reader, I was able to finish the game within a few hours even with a bit of idle time. Because of this, I can only recommend getting this game on sale--it's overpriced as-is.

24816665.review:
Love at First Sight is a visual novel based around the main character slowly falling in love with a girl, who happens to have a singular large eyeball instead of the usual two. It is essentially, a simple love story minus the depth and complexity that most novels have.

First things first, I like the art style – it has that indie vibe that makes it stands out. It’s not over-the-top beautifully wonderful that make your eyes moist – but it works nonetheless. Thumbs up!

Unfortunately the music is, for the most part, colourless. There are a couple of songs that are passable, but all of the tracks repeat themselves too often, so it’s better played with the volume on low. Thumbs down.

Now for the main story. It’s… barely above average I guess. There’s just no real ‘meat’ to it. For me, a visual novel (or any game for that matter) needs to either be entertaining, exciting, original, funny, shocking, or at the very least, somewhat interesting – and sadly, Love at First Sight scarcely delivers in a couple of those categories.

Overall, if you’re a heavy fan of visual novels, and see this one on a sale, than maybe this will be for you. It’s okay for light reading and, well, it DOES have a cute girl with one eye. Just don’t expect too much.

Score: 59/100

24101109.review:
Sachi is your typical one-eyed girl next door that you've always had a crush on... 
Wait, one-eyed girl?

This short visual novel describes a slice of life scenario where a young man, Mamoru, falls in love with the moderately-bruised Sachi, who only longs to have a smile worthy of the name her parents gave her (sorry Grisaia!) There really is nothing that stands out too much in this VN:  Boy falls in love with girl, girl reciprocates, they date, she meets his friends, he meets her relative, girl learns to stand up for herself... everything here is something anyone over 15-18 has already seen or experienced, whether first hand experience or through an entertainment medium.  

The story doesn't overstay its welcome, though it'd have been worthwhile if we could have had more unique scenarios. Backgrounds are heavily reused, there aren't a lot of variety to sprites, characters are not voiced.  BUT despite these flaws (if you would call them that), the entire story is a warm, feel-good experience.  Characters have well-defined, one-dimensionsal personalities, but Sachi especially exhibits some growth, which is nice to see.  Though initially weak and spineless, Sachi is likeable and it's fun seeing her mature overly the course of the story.  Sachi's eye is initially viewed as something to be embarassed about, but Mamoru is not repulsed, or even attracted, by this unique aspect.  The eye isn't a big problem; very little about the story would be changed even if Sachi had two eyes. It differentiates Sachi but doesn't define her.  -------> [Good moral to glean]

To sum it up, the story/art is pretty generic, but it'll make you feel good inside.  It's worth a read or two.  

I'd recommend this to anyone with a few hours to kill, or as an intro to a VN rookie.

簡単にいえば、単眼っ子と学園生活の中で仲良くなっていちゃつくゲームです。
あぁ！待って待って！、「単眼はちょっと・・・」なんて言わないで！まずは偏見を捨てて純粋に聞いて！

自分も属性としては単眼はあんまり・・・ってクチだったのですが、このゲームをプレイする事で逆に好きになりました。
それも単眼っ子といっても本当に控えめな小動物みたいで、見ているだけで守ってあげたくなるような可愛い女の子です。
実際プレイしてると「あぁ・・・こんな子が彼女になんねぇかな」って気持ちになりますし、単眼という一見最初はデメリットに見えた特徴が
だんだんと愛らしく見えてきて、まさしく「ひと目惚れ」してしまいます。
恋愛ゲーといってもノベルゲーなので選択肢はないのですがそこは別に自分としては気にするポイントにはなりませんでした。
是非、単眼っ子はちょっとなぁ・・・という人も値段もそんなに高くもないのでプレイしてみるのをオススメします。
では改めてこのゲームをギフトしてくれたフレンドよ、ありがとう。

ここからは雑談で
僕はTeaching Feelingというアダルトゲームから作者の事を知っていて個人的には大好きな絵柄という事で気に入っていて、
そこから作品を追う感じでsteamでこのゲーム見つけプレイしたクチなのですが、
この作者、非常に偏った属性というか欠損など、一般の方々からは引かれやすい趣向を持っているのですが、それと同時にその属性を非常に魅力的に見せる上に、可愛らしいキャラ付けをするという事がとても上手いです。
Twitterやpixivで新しい作品が出るたびに、まるで新しい属性に目覚めるようです。
Ray-Kと検索すれば出てくる筈なので是非作品を見てみては如何でしょうか。
あとTeaching Feelingという奴隷少女と生活するゲームもDMMで週間1位を何週間も独占したことがある上、頻繁にアップデートが行われていて良い作品なのでそちらもオススメします。

23880812.review:
I bought this game because of the store pic.

Thought it looked interesting, and after beating the game, my opinion hasn't changed. Plot revolves around the protagonist falling in love with a cyclops, who's shy and has been bullied because of her condition. His two friends help him out a little bit after he gets closer to her, and they all become good friends in the end. I really felt that the protagonist was a bit too forward and chatty.

He kept asking all of these questions, in his attempts to be friends with the cyclops, that it came off as cringey to me. It toned down in the later acts, but still, it was awkward and weird. Especially since his friend, Akemi, is supposed to be the chatterbox in the group.

The acts felt short to me, but surprisingly, I managed to finish the game in about two hours. The extras unlocked after beating the game is pretty interesting, as the developer revealed he had time constraints when making this game, and thought about making it a doujinshi.

Which, for those that don't know, is a manga. I highly recommend going through all the extra content after finishing the game, and viewing the epilogue scenes. I don't really have anything bad to say about the game, since this was made during time constraints, but I would like to say that I'll be supporting any future releases by the dev, who made a great game.

Thought the transitions where you had to press enter several times, and going from classroom to the halls, was pretty cute and immersive. I can see some people finding that off-putting though, but regardless, and like most games, it's all up to preference.

Oh, and the game is more of a kinetic novel than anything, which doesn't have choices.

[h1] Сюжет: [/h1]

Относительно небольшая новелла, расказывающая о девочке со странным физиологическим отклонением и о не так давно переведённом в новую школу парне. 

Основное повествование идёт от того самого парнишки, но при этом на некоторое время повествователь будет меняться, дабы рассмотреть определённую ситуацию с разных сторон. Новелла займёт 3 часа чтения и т.к. является кинетической, будет иметь линейный сюжет. 
 
Конечно я не могу сказать, что это прям идеальная новелла, но всё же как по мне, было довольно интересно (исключая моменты каких-то глупых просьб героев друг к другу). Да и в целом новелла напомнила мне *Ханако рут* (Katawa shoujo), ибо слишком много сходств. 

[h1] Далее в деталях: [/h1]

По музыке ничего особенного, хотя soundtrack был не навязчивым и даже приятным на слух. 

Насчёт рисовки также ничего хорошего сказать не могу, лично мне был не совсем приятен подобный стиль (но это уже мои придирки, так что...). 

Взвешивая все пункты, я всё же рекомендую уделить этой новелле чуточку своего внимания.

23271279.review:
Покупая игру с одноглазой девочкой на скриншотах, вы ожидаете, что одноглазовость данного персонажа будет ключевой темой произведения, или что вас погрузят в выдуманный мир, где подобные девочки имеют место быть.

Но всё оказывается совсем не так. За место одноглазой девочки вы просто читаете об обычной среднестатистической героине, которую обижают, и которая имет некоторый дефект, слегка портящий её повседневную жизнь. Ружьё, висящее на стене с томным желание однажды выстрелить, так и не выстреливает на протяжении всего произведения.

А произведение это, стоит отметить, весьма и весьма посредственное. История не имеет в своём арсенале ни уникальных ситуаций, ни интересных персонажей, ни каких бы то ни было шуток. И даже не имеет стилистически интересно написаного текста. "Love at First Sight" является эссенцией повседневных историй, из которой удалили всё, что могло принести удовольствие и отложиться в памяти игроков, и оставили лишь серые ничем не примечательные моменты типа "первая встреча", "поход в кино", "защита от хулигана" и т.п.

Интересная визуально игра привлекает внимание, но не дарит эстетическое удовольствие за прочтение истории, не поднимает необычные темы, на которые казалось бы претендует, и даже не пытается быть единственной в своём роде.

"Love at First Sight" - это пустая трата времени, которая может прийтись по вкусу лишь игрокам, не видевшим типичных романтических повседневных историй.

23052817.review:
For a game made in 2 months this's fairly impressive, but for a game on Steam with an asking price of  $10 it's very underwhelming.

I understand the constraints the dev was under to get this game ready in time for a convention he wished to sell it at, but there's no reason why afterwards, when the pressure was gone, that he couldn't have revisited the title and expanded upon it before putting it onto a larger market, such as Steam.

As it stands the story is decent, but nothing spectacular. More than once there were times you'd expect there to be more shown, but he just ends up alluding to events and then skipping right over them (presumably cuts made to get the game done on time). The story with the main antagonist ended in a very unsatisfactory manner, though I will refrain from expanding on that any further to avoid spoilers. Most of the side characters also didn't really get as much time as I would have liked in order to get to know them better. Also - unless you share in some of the creator's fetishes for things like injuries - a lot of the dialog will seem forced, weird or unnecessary as they are mainly tacked on to serve his own indulgences.

The art style is nice and the main selling point that drew me to this title. Though as with everything else about this game, it would have been nice to have had more of it, for instance there was very little by way of CG stills/cutscenes. However, it does have a far more coherent and enjoyable aesthetic than most other amateur VN offerings and deserves a fair bit of praise for that alone.

Sound was just so-so. Some of the music could use a bit of work, there were some grating off key notes thrown in inexpertly throughout a few of the tracks that detracted from my enjoyment, but otherwise the soundtrack was ok and fit the story well enough.

Overall, I enjoyed it, but the creator really should put another 2-4 months into completing this, then this would be well worth the asking price and a highly recommended title for those who enjoy quirky VNs. But as it stands I can't recommend it unless you find it on a pretty decent sale, as you just wont get your money's worth otherwise.

I've had my eye on this visual novel for a while, and after playing it, I can see why people like it. The story is told through the lens of Mamoru, who one day meets Sachi, a pupil who is regularly bullied and has lost sight of her dreams. When Mamoru first contacts her, she is very shy towards him. Since this is a kinetic VN, most of the story is told through one point of view, and the exploration of themes is a bit near-sighted because of its short length, but for what it's worth, this is a pretty decent feel-good game that doesn't lose focus on its artistic vision. 22765795.review:
Sweet, unusual and heartwarming. I will try to keep this completely spoiler-free, which means I will probably not talk much about it story-wise.

- Story and Characters

You must have noticed that the heroine of this VN isn't your mainstream moe heroine, she's way more cute and interesting. I won't say anything else about her, because I found out that actually getting to know her through the story is what made this such a great experience for me.

The story is short and the cast small, but I loved every part of it, even the slightly strange ones.
You have two very likeable characters as your support casting, who are not just filling up the space, but instead have their own things going on. Their personalities are also built very clear, so that the way they act and interact with you and the other characters feels very natural.

Also, don't forget to check the Extras after you finish. There are a few extra scenes there.

- VN

Now, for the technical stuff.
This is a linear visual novel with a single route. Which means it's more like a digital book than a game itself, and to be fair most visual novels are exactly that. I would say the greatest selling point of this kind of product is that you get an experience similar to those you would get from reading books, comics or manga, but with the extras allowed by the medium used to convey the story.

A story can be conveyed in many different forms. A linear visual novel allows you to attach shifting scenes to every piece of dialogue, with characters in different poses over backgrounds. You are also allowed to place pictures drawn for special events, and in this game's case, even small cutscenes for every chapter title. And finally, wrap it all up with music fitting for every moment. This is an experience that is most close to reading a novel, with many additionals you'd only get from it being digital.
If this is what you came here looking for, then Love at First Sight is indeed what you want.

- Art

As for the art, I feel particularly drawn to the hard lines and the painting style, which reminds me of another VN that I live very much, which is Danganronpa. The animated cutscenes are very well made and looked really cute. I enjoyed it.

- Music

The music in the game feels really nice to the ears and blends well with the ambience. Most of the times, I barely even notice it's presence, as I felt it was part of the scene itself and not just something on the background. My regards to kyou1110 for the great work, though I did like every song of the game.

- Conclusion

Finally, I want to congratulate Ray-K for making this great game. Making a game isn't easy, and making a game by yourself is a hard challenge. But, making a game of this quality by yourself is no short of heroic. People like you and Toby Fox are what I consider heroes in this industry. So, in short, thank you very much.

22764640.review:
A cute little VN with a simple but very heart-warming story. An enjoyable reading for a relaxing afternoon. 
The story itself is a pretty straightforword romance tale. There're no surprising plot-turning events. Everything goes exactly as you expect it would be, yet in a very delicate and graceful way. 
Sachi is extremely adorable depite her extraordinary look, and I fell in love with her at the first sight just like the protagonist did. Her character development is also smooth and believable, and gets you attached to her from start to end. Unfortunately other characters could use a more polish, maybe especially for Mayumi. 
Art design is the selling point here IMO. Ray-K's heavy, rough and somewhat eerie style gives the game a distinguishing look just like the heroine. It may not look as exquisite as some of the other VNs, but it's stunningly beautiful and fits the theme very well. 
Music is  pretty simple, nothing stands out but certainly not annoying. Missing Love is a nice little piece.   
There're also some fun stuff to check out in Extras after finishing the story if you are interested. They give some insights about the game's development, also some mini episodes that add to the main story.
To sum up, if you like a sweet, peaceful romance story with a very adorable girl that makes you urge to sympahize and protect,  definitely give this one a try.

Overall, if you want a quick, cheap visual novel, this isn't a bad choice.

ちょっと前に話題になったエロゲーの"Teaching Feeling 奴隷との生活"の作者のRay-Kbysさんがそちらの前から発表していたノベルゲー。和名ではひと目惚れ.
Teaching Feelingはプレイしたことないので詳細は知らないのですが、神ゲーらしいです。

この作品を一言で表すと、もうとにかくヒロインの単眼少女の臼井幸がひたすらかわいいということです。
健気で謙虚で真面目で、でも自分の外見にコンプレックスがあるがためのおどおどとした様子が抜群に保護欲を刺激します。
そんな彼女にしつこく話しかけて、打ち解けようとして、徐々に関係が進展していく様はもう最高ですね。眼福です。
イベントではさまれる餌付けをするシーンや、オシャレな格好で対面するシーンはもう何回でも見直しました。SSも100枚くらい撮りました。めっちゃ[strike]抜けます[/strike]泣けます。
あと登場する友人がいい人ばかりなのも好感をもてます。
もっと拒絶とか、反論とか、いろいろないの？とかって思う人もいるかもしれませんが、個人的にはドロドロした韓国の恋愛ドラマのような胃に穴があきそうなお話は嫌いなので、ちょっとライトなくらいで、途中からは終始ベタベタして糖尿病になるくらい甘ったるくて思わず爆撃したくなるようなお話のほうが好きです。
ただそれで終わるだけでなく、ちゃんと登場人物それぞれの考えがありますし、途中で視点が変わって話が進んだりするのも登場人物の理解が進むのでGood.

先天奇形のひとつの単眼症を患って生まれた子供は、出生後すぐ亡くなってしまうので、臼井幸の年齢まで生きている子はまずいないらしいですが、そんなことは気にしてはいけないんです。

とにもかくにもかわいい、KAWAII、めちゃんこかわいいです。
普段ホラーサウンドノベル(かまいたちの夜、忌火起草、暑いから(フリーゲーム)etc...)をプレイすることはあっても、恋愛ノベルはまったくプレイしない私ですが、購入してよかったと心のそこから思えるすンばらしい作品です。
続編製作中らしいので、そちらがでたら１００％即日買います。
2時間くらいでクリアできてしまいますし、ストーリーも分岐なし、ボイスなしですが、買って損はしないと思います。セールを待たずに買ってもいいと思います。

ちなみに作者さんのpixivには臼井幸以外にもかわいらしい奇形の子とかいっぱいです。
奇形じゃない子もいます。どの子も魅力的で見てて楽しいです。
えっちな絵もえっちじゃない絵もグロい絵もむっちゃ興奮するので超オススメです。
ぜひ見に行ってみてください。

22260221.review:
Todos los puntos importantes de una novela visual:
[list]
[*] [b]Dibujo:[/b] El estilo de Ray-K: Le gustan las temáticas oscuras como el gore... En este juego se nota su estilo aunque de forma más suave en comparación con sus ilustraciones.
[*] [b]Fondos:[/b] Los fondos acompañan al diseño de los personajes y a las situaciones. No hay demasiados tampoco pero la historia es corta.
[*] [b]Historia:[/b] Es una historia corta pero suficiente. Puede resultar conodida (repetida): Chica con problemas, protagonista que intenta protegerla, aparece el amor en el proceso.
[*] [b]Personajes:[/b] Los personajes rellenan la historia. No hay demasiados pero realmente muy en el fondo solo te interesa Sachi, la chica cíclope.
[*] [b]Música:[/b] la música acompaña a la historia sin entrometerse demasiado. No produce grades sensaciones pero tampoco es música de ascensor. Hace agradable la experiencia del juego.
[*] [b]Rutas:[/b] Sólo existe una ruta. No hay decisiones que tomar. El propio autor comenta que este hecho le decepciona pero que por tiempo no puedo hacer todo lo que quiso.
[*] Doblaje: No tiene voz.
[*] Idioma: Está disponible en japonés y en Inglés. La traducción al inglés es correcta y sencilla. No se necesita mucho nivel de inglés para disfrutarla.
[*] [b]Contenido extra:[/b] Tienes disponibles todas las ilustraciones, pistas de audio y exras sobre los personajes, la historia y los pensamientos del autor.
[/list]

En Steam tienes logros, cartas y demás.

Si te ha llamado la atención seguramente sea porque la protagonista es una chica cíclope.
Si eres fan de las monster girls, ya sea por [i]Monster Girl Encyclopedia[/i], [i]Monster Girl Quest[/i] o por proyectos ejn curso como [i]Monster Girl Island[/i] o [i]Breeding Season[/i] o por cualquier otra relación con la temática monster girl este es el juego que necesitas en tu biblioteca de Steam.

22048060.review: I first saw this game from a youtuber who does a bunch of anime style games (LostPause aka Noble), he did one episode on it that lasted about 30 or so minutes. I had always wanted him to continue this game but after I played it myself I see why he didn't. This game is simple, the creator even bashes himself for doing this in the afternotes, however I like the game more cause of it. There's no way to fail this game, no way to go down a path you didn't want to take, no way to mess something up. The music, as simplistic as it is, is very nice and catchy and changes somewhat frequently, my most favorite track was when there was drama with Rui. The story is nice and simple, shy girl who has no courage or anything like that and gets bullied, falls in love with a boy who loves her back, she slowly comes out of her shell and even stands up to her bully, an almost cliche type of character development but at least it's there, some games the characters develop so little during hours of gameplay if at all. The only thing that really makes Sachi different is the fact that she's a cyclops, other than that she's no different from anyone else, and as a guy who doesn't judge on appearances I easily see why Ma-Kun (don't want to type his name wrong) was attracted to her, heck I'd date her if she existed. Could this game be longer, yes (note it says I have like 7 hours into the game but I had left it running while did other things) but just because it's short is really only something that an individual has to decides is a good or bad thing. Do you want a game that you play for hours and not get anywhere significant (like most rpg's) or do you want to play a game that's short but be entertained while you play for those few short hours. Is this a perfect game, no but most aren't, I personally would've liked to see Tomo and Akemi get more and more intimate and actually admit how they feel, round 2 of Ms. Bully (Rui) and Ms. Upbeat (Akemi), and even a b*tch slap delivered to Rui via the small scarred hand of Sachi, but those are personal nitpicks, maybe in a continuation of this story and again I would prefer it this style, simple straight to the point, just something that you'll sit down to for an hour or two just to enjoy a nice little romance story without the filler of anime or the images of manga or the complexity of a dating sim (cause let's be honest some of these styles of games can be pretty complex with their choice/path system and all sorts of flags) I would personally rate this a 4/5, it's simple, fun, no hassle, just an overrall carefree game. I recommend this to any fan of anime, manga, and vn's who just want to a nice time and relax.

Ok, eye will do my best to hold off on the ocular related puns.

This game is short, sweet and to the point. 

The characters are pretty interesting and likeable for the most part, although the MC is a bit of a goose at times and a tad pushy but hey, considering how short the game is (2 or so hours) a fair amount of development goes on and any shortcomings in character development are hardly noticible.  The pacing and story is great with only a few dull moments here and there.

This isn't a typical romance VN. Its not overly cheesy, has more going on thematically then just romance including some kind of unsettling moments, and other characters (well 2 out of the 3 more minor ones) actually have a significant role to play in the story, so you don't  feel like you're trapped following a hapless protag around while he tries to get laid.

Pros
- Great art style. which is mostly what caught my eye about the game (heuheuheuhueh)
- Music is pretty decent too.
- The story is interesting enough and has some pretty cool moments
- SACHI!!!!!!!
- Short and good for when you don't feel like taking on a 50+ hour epic with 1000+ choices.
- No choices (could be a pro or con)
- Got oddly aroused during a certain scene and now find myself asking some hard questions.

Cons
- It could be a bit longer but by the Devs own admission, he rushed the game to reach a deadline and didn't get to add more routes/ choices etc.
- Sometimes the protag is kind of annoying, but hey, writing facless yet relatible characters that players can project onto is hard.


10/10 would date a cyclops gorl again.

20981916.review:
This sure was a strange experience. ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) 

The game itself is a very limited Visual Novel. There's only one path to take, you have no conversation options and it's basically just a pimped out graphic novel for you to click through. The story is a bit lackluster and "typical" as far as <insert yourself here> VN's go. 

Even after all these faults, why do I recommend this game? Because I learned a lot about the process and how this game came to be via the bonus content that you unlock after finishing the game and I have a lot of respect for the creator and how he handled his situation. This is basically a one-man-show and he created it in the shortest time period. Mad props.

That being out the way, this is an extremely charming little VN with some slightly unusual subject matter which sould be pretty obvious if you're looking at this. It's a short VN, one route, no choices, some neat extras, on paper nothing special. 
However with the rather unique subject matter of wooing a cyclops, some scenes that touch on some rather awkward subjects (nothing particularly explicit, violent or gruesome, just to put your mind at rest), the very fitting art style and instantly lovable heroine that you just wanna hug and protect and take home with you it all comes together as a very enjoyable read. 
It's a little bit on the short side, however it is well worth picking up if you're looking for some light romantic reading with a twist.

20316544.review:
《Love at First Sight》是一款日式視覺小說遊戲，也是由網路爆紅的情色遊戲《奴隷との生活》製作人Ray-K打造的校園戀愛喜劇，不過本作為全年齡向的作品，大家就不用對不存在的十八禁內容產生過多的期待。從遊戲大標題來看，大家一定可以理解到男女主角為何會成為戀人，正所謂一見鍾情（Love at First Sight）是真愛，轉學來到新環境不到兩個月的高中二年級生〝福永 護〞，因緣際會之下發現刻意躲在屋頂遠離人群的獨眼少女〝臼井 幸〞，為了協助封閉自我又疑似遭到同儕霸凌的獨眼少女，轉學生開始去認識與關懷對方，試圖幫助孤獨的少女回到人群，重拾幸福快樂的高校生活，不過始料未及的是，兩人萌生超越友誼的情感，成為甜死人不償命的熱戀情侶。


先從女主角的形象說起，〝臼井 幸〞擁有一顆充滿魅力的大眼球，玩家隱約能看到隱藏在破舊制服之下的皮肉傷，最後搭配小動物個性讓這名獨眼少女成為惹人憐愛的小兔子。如果大家先前有關注過製作人Ray-K早期作品就會發現他非常喜歡帶有殘疾屬性和心理病態的女性角色，如果要說《奴隷との生活》的女主角〝希爾薇〞是身體充滿傷疤且失去情感的欠損少女，那麼〝臼井 幸〞就是因長相與常人不同而遭到大眾排擠的怪胎，她就像是醜陋的鐘樓怪人，只能躲在無人知曉的地方等待真正理解自己的人出現。


接下來談談劇情，校園生活沒有甚麼比培養同儕關係來還得重要，因為長相被同學霸凌的〝臼井 幸〞成為了學校的幽靈學生，除了同班同學以外，其他班級的學生幾乎沒有真正看過她的廬山真面目，甚至就連師長都鮮少知道這名學生的存在。直到某日，轉學生〝福永 護〞在放學時間時聽到屋頂傳來微弱的少女哭泣聲，這才讓兩人相見，一開始全身滿佈傷痕的獨眼少女無法信任他人，直到她發現對方不是來者不善的惡人，這才逐漸打開心房，兩人雖然沒有直接說出口，但是心裡早已明白，對方就是命運中的另一半。


整體來說，本作雖然在故事展開上沒有太多亮點，劇情起伏平淡沒有明顯高潮起伏，就是一對笨蛋情侶在到處放閃搞曖昧，但是不得不說本作在登場人物立繪與角色性格描繪都令筆者感到非常驚艷，就連探討校園霸凌議題更是一針見血，現實生活中無時無刻正在發生校園霸凌，即便這幾年來政府不斷宣導反霸凌活動，霸凌案件非但沒有減少反倒是逐年增加，最糟糕的是學校為了保護校譽總是會要求媒體封鎖消息，甚至要被害人和加害者的雙方家長私下和解息事寧人，這些都是作為家長的人父人母不樂見的結果。總而言之，《Love at First Sight》不是一款感人到止不住淚水的悲劇作品，也不是賣弄女性肉體殺必死大放送的紳士作品，它是讓你發自內心想要疼愛飽受煎熬少女的真性情之作。


優點：
+畫風討喜，女主角惹人憐愛，淚汪汪的大眼睛超級可愛。
+英文翻譯字幕的文字用語簡單，大約是國中程度的英語程度。
+討論校園霸凌議題，批評人們只因為對方長相不同就欺壓他人。


缺點：
-故事敘述平淡，少了高潮起伏讓人想跳過一些無趣的劇情橋段。


結論：閃光彈等級Max，遊玩時請配戴墨鏡，可惜這些機會都不是屬於我的。


網誌圖文好讀版：
http://mgrim214.blogspot.tw/2016/01/love-at-first-sight.html

Before i say anything, i'd like to say that Sachi (the cyloptic love interest of the story's protagonist) is just [b]adorable![/b] I don't care how creepy i'm gonna sound for saying that! While i was reading through this visual novel; i kept thinking, "aww, it's  just so damn cute and adorable"

The music is a bit meh but it does what it needs to do. Though there's nothing explicitly NSFW in the story, there are a few on the nose moments; it kinda makes the game feel more innocent and cute.

I really want a sequel!

I wouldn't say I like visual novels, per se. It's more of, I accept it as a platform required to tell stories--and so long as such stories are good, I am fine with them...

However, I could not imagine this story told in any other format. The feelings that the story gave me were quite immersive, as well as beautifully written in a simplistic--yet poetic--style to where I could feel my heart melt with each click of a page. Without spoiler, I will simply say that my heart had sank, stopped, and melted with every emotion under the sun with the help of this wonderous piece.
There are some strange sub-text fields, I'll admit--but having of known several 'quirky' individuals everything is actually all the more authentic. If you've ever enjoyed a heart-felt romance manga or anime, I'd highly reccomend this. Considering most manga are 14.99$, and this only sells for 10$ when not on sale, it's a very grande deal.

日本でバカ売れした伝説のアダルトゲーム

の作者がその前に制作した作品です

この作者の特徴として
【ヒロインは不幸な少女だが自分とその周りの人間は善意の塊の様な人々しか居ない】

19499273.review:
Love at First Sight is a fun little story. It's not deep, but it has some amusingly self-aware fetishy moments (eyes, scars) and a neat concept for anyone who likes the whole moe monstergirl thing. Unfortunately, I'm not able to recommend it. After less than two hours of play, I'd seen every scene and acquired every achievement. There is no replay value, there are no alternate routes. There is no clever twist - every plot development is visible from a mile away, and there aren't very many of them to begin with. The characters are flat, one-note cliches, and the final conflict in the story consists of the antagonist (who has no motive) just... deciding to leave, forever. It's cute, sure, but it's also short and kind of boring.

At £6.99, I absolutely can't recommend it. I got it on sale, and I still don't feel like I really got value for money.

19318917.review:
Despite the time-limited development of 2 months of serious work, and the 2-man dev team of Ray-Kbys and kyou1110 (kyou helping with most of the music, Ray-K doing everything else), this visual novel manages to produce a touching-yet-refreshing story, with a cast of 6 underused-stereotype characters and more than decent writing in plot and character development. As a personal fan of Ray-Kbys' artwork, this piece displays some of his most inspired 2-D animations, which are short, but are used to astounding effect. This being a fairly short piece (I finished all content within 5 hours), hearing that this may have been a full-blown dating sim game with a branching story (if Ray-K hadn't procrastinated until 2 moths before) raises my hopes that Ray-Kbys may try his more determined hand at a full-blown dating sim one day.

I highly recommend this game to anyone who likes vanilla romance visual novels, people who like cute anime games, people who like unique artwork, people who are into injury/cyclops girls/sickeningly sweet romance fetishes, and just people with good humor, as this VN displays all these qualities and more. Just enough character development is placed into the story to entice veteran 2D romance enthusiasts and critics of the genre alike. As an added benefit, the cards for this game sell for nearly as much as the game itself on 50% off atm, assuming you don't wish to collect them for the rare adorable-cyclops-girl Steam backgrounds, so buy away!

Well worth $5, still worth $10 for VN enthusiasts. You're supporting an excellent and unique artist, after all.

18929056.review:
When you look past the strange heroine, [i]Love at First Sight[/i] is a pretty straightforward high school romance VN. There's no ero in the game itself, but it has a few ero-guro undertones that might be off-putting for some. Even so, there's a certain soft grace to it all; Ray-K's painterly style brings warmth and tenderness to every scene, catching the restrained giddiness of young love in a way that might be lost with cleaner, flatter designs. It is, in a word, comfy.

The characters are likeable, for the most part, with Sachi standing head and shoulders over any run-of-the-mill moeblob love interest. She invites sympathy and the urge to protect, but her vulnerability never really grates. The music doesn't stand out by any means, but its gentleness supports the cozy atmosphere well.

There is very little beyond the story's single path, unfortunately — about two hours of content in all. Even the most casual reader will chew through it quickly, and depending on their tastes, they'll probably be left wanting more. It's perhaps not enough to warrant the full $10. But if it's on sale and you have five bucks to spare, time spent on crisp autumn back-streets with a cute cyclops girl is time well invested.

Admittedly, I might be biased here; that wide, bottomless eye will ease open your chest and grope the scars. But isn't that the point?

Pick this up if you enjoy cutely macabre aesthetics, monster girls, romance, and if you see it on sale.

---
+ Cute monster girl heroine
+ Cozy autumn setting
+ Warm, comfy art style
+ The extra features serve as a fun little epilogue and development backstory
+ When you're done with the story and extras, check the creator's Pixiv for a bit more

- Only one story path
- That one path is a little bare-bones and straightforward
- At 2-3 hours, the VN is extremely short — perhaps too short to justify a $10 price tag

18909500.review:
[h1] Кто сказал бы мне, что я буду в это играть хоть пару лет назад - я бы не поверил [/h1]

Хочется начать с упоминания того, насколько же сама игра похожа на главную героиню - робкая, боязливая, боясщаяся внимания. Игра была сделана всего за два месяца фактически одним человеком (помощь была оказана лишь при написании фоновой музыки), и получилась довльно греющая сердце история. В ней нет ни развилок, ведущих к разным концовкам, ни секретных персонажей, ни разношёрстных знойных девиц. Из этой игры вполне можно было бы сделать мангу, но, как сказал сам автор, слишком много мороки с редакцией и прочей оффициальной волокитой. [b] Но что же на счёт самой игры? стоит ли она того? [/b].

[h1] Да, она того стоит. [/h1]

Нам рассказывают историю о странной девочке, плачущей на ступенях лестницы, ведущей на крышу. Заурядно? Скорее всего, если бы не одно [u] но[/u]. И от чего-то это кажется шокирующим по началу, и столь обыденным спустя некоторое время. Но ведь ты не хочешь обидеть милашку тыча в неё своим пальцем? Конечно же нет. Вот и наш протоганист не хочет. Более того, он хочет подружиться с ней. Всё ещё заурядно? Какие мы придирчивые. Рисовка выглядит не слишком ярко, но и не блёкло - как раз для истории вроде этой, фоновая музыка прекрасная, диалоги и стиль повествования очень и очень хороши.
И потом... Зачем ты всё ещё это читаешь? Неужели ты всё ещё не [b] влюбился в эту милашку с первого взгляда? [/b]

18391051.review:
Love at First Sight is a simple romance visual novel, and its a very adorable one at that. While it may not have the action, cast, or production budget of bigger name VNs, I actually prefer small and simple ones like this. The whole thing is over in about two to three hours, but it manages to tell its story well enough.
Starting with the positives of the game, the between-chapter animations are adorable. The very first time I saw one I let out an audible squeal that I am not ashamed of. Theyre simple but well executed in ways that will make your heart melt. Continuing with the uguu-train, Sachi herself is a very adorable love interest and easily one of my favorites, even out of bigger name VNs that Ive played. Although her character isnt anything new, the person who made the game knew what they were doing and how to use Sachi for maximum effectiveness. I would take one Sachi over a hundred Sakura Matous any day. 
The supporting cast of the VN is also very enjoyable, however scarse they are. There is only six named characters in the entire VN, and while that is a disappointing thing, the cahracters are all likeable enough that you wont even care. Akemi and her explosively cheerful attitude and Tomo's indifference play off of each other like poetry, and I really enjoy seeing characters like them. As stated before, Sachi is one of my favorite VN characters. She makes my heart sing. The main character, Mamoru is bland as white bread, but that is of course to be expected of a VN protag so that the reader can realte more. If he went around kicking puppies, then I dont think many people could relate.
Unfortunately after the good must come the bad, and Ill start with the worst offender that youll be dealing with the whole game: The music is terrible. It sounds like a cheap MIDI on a fifteen second loop. I understand that the game was made by a single person, and I understand that you might not be an author AND a composer, but its still a negative.
The plot is a standard VN highschool plot: Boy transfers in, boy has small or nonexistant group of friends, finds outcast girl, helps her come out of her shell, kiss kiss fall in love, and then help her overcome her main issue in the story. If youre expecting twists and turns, then you are a fool. While the plot and character archetypes are all very known by this point, I do have to mention that they are all well done, especially for how long the VN is.
For the praise I gave Akemi earlier, I must tack on some sins as well. The game doesnt allow her to be as expressive as she is due to the limited facial expressions and poses that it provides. This doesnt detract from her character of my enjoyment of the VN, but it does leave me wanting more out of her that I will be unable to have.
Now we have to get to the elephant in the room: Why does Sachi have two tear ducts when she only has one eye? Huh? Seriously though, the elephant is the scar scenes. I had no idea I was into that kinda thing, but it's said you get a new fetish everyday, right? While the "normal and well adjusted" people playing this will inevitably be very weirded out, I welcome the scar scenes for all they are, and enjoyed them. I didnt see it as Mamoru just being a creeper, but instead as a show that Sachi trusts him enough to let him touch her in places she's been hurt at. That being said, the fact that Mamoru himself points out to the reader how strange it is to be doing it does not actually make it any less strange. In fact, shining a light on it like that only brings more attention to it, as opposed to letting the scenes flow natually as they should.
Overall Id say this visual novel is fairly high on my list, as I enjoyed it immensely. It may just be my love of monster girls and apparently scars talking, but I give this game a very deserved 8.5/10. Id highly recommend this game. I look forward to seeing more of this creator's work in the future and wish the best for him.

18095267.review:
没想到还能在Steam上看到这款游戏，必定是要买来支持的。
虽然单线而且流程很短，但真的十分精致，立绘、CG、背景以及每章节的过场动画都恰到好处，除去部分日式表达，英文版的行文也比较流畅，人物的性格塑造与内心活动的描写也让人很有代入感。
美中不足的是BGM着实有点猎奇了，后记上作者说除了BGM以外都是他本人做的，恐怕跟这有一定关系吧。
整个故事的氛围就是温暖人心的，尽管说幸薄还有牵扯到校园欺凌的问题，但登场角色都在积极地面对并与伙伴们试图解决这些事情，使得这些设定并没有把整个故事搞得非常灰暗。尽管画风也不像个王道纯爱的画风，但这作毫无疑问是在讲一个很治愈的校园纯爱故事，投入进去后就会发现女主角不管有几只眼睛都无所谓了……
可惜还是短了点啊，感觉一些线索都没走完的……

18001196.review:
[h1]冒险游戏[/h1]
注重探索与互动 同时兼顾剧情以及游戏性 至今依然是3A游戏的主流之一 
而这两个主要要素 必然决定了冒险游戏发展的两个趋势

[h1]一种[/h1]
弱化剧情 专注于游戏性 或锻炼手 或锻炼脑
带给人肢体或思维上的完成感

[h1]另一种[/h1]
弱化游戏性 专注于剧情 不同于手脑的判断力和逻辑考验
致力于体会人际之间的互动感

[h1]VN[/h1]
作为AVG一大分支ADV/GAL的衍生物 摒弃了大多数的游戏性 纯粹表现剧情 突出人际关系
以或玄幻或科幻的世界观
或生离死别或盘根错节的各类感情
带给人或天马行空或勾魂摄魄的思维冲击
带给人或治愈或致郁的感情雕琢

而不断涌现的优秀作品 也带给开发者更大的难度
使得游戏背景越来越离奇 剧情越来越虐心 而玩家却越来越麻木

[h1]Love at First Sight[/h1]
不要被游戏介绍吓到
本游戏并不含魔幻怪诞元素 并不含极端剧情波折
这款游戏其实是一个非常不错的清新调味品
平平淡淡的世界背景 平平淡淡的纯爱短篇
在这个以“妄想”文化为剧情主流的时代
让我们静下心来 放松大脑
体会这平淡的故事带来的微感动

17717547.review:
Love at First Sight is a Romance Visual Novel. It had a development time of 2 months and it clearly shows.

Starting with the positive, the art style is very charming and I loved the design of all the characters. The visuals work very well in favour of the slightly dark yet mostly heart-warming story.

The music is fine, Nothing outstanding in terms of a VN. I wasn't bothered by it and really enjoyed a couple of them despite their short looping time. There isn't much else in terms of sound though, and there is no voice acting.

In terms of the story the primary flaw would have to be the length. Easily the most common complaint at this point. I finished one playthrough on a leisurely pace in 1 hours and 30 minutes. $10 for less than 2 hours of playtime is undeniably a steep price. Other than that, the conflict of the story resolves itself very abruptly. Everything just feels rushed. (Which as the Author has stated, it was)

Personally I enjoyed the experience but I just cannot recommend buying it.

17659464.review:
Love at First Sight is a definite must have - doubly so if it is on sale. While the story itself is fairly generic, that is hardly the point of the game. The game is about Sachi growing and finding happiness, which is handled absurdly well. The supporting characters are well done as well. They actually felt like living, breathing people as opposed to the common Mary Sue. 
The game is short, I'm not going to lie about that, but there is not a problem with a short game; problems arise with poor pacing, which usually goes hand in hand with short length. That is not the case with L@FS, while the game only took me two hours to complete, the pacing was impeccable. While I would love it to be longer, thats not really an issue with the game but more that Sachi is really cute and I didn't want it to end.
Seriously, the pacing is good enough that they could extrapolate a 6 or so episode OVA.
The extras were fun as well, with I believe 4 additional scenes available that gives a nice epilogue to the characters and an afterward by the author. 
Seriously if there is one thing I will say about this game is that it has staying power. You might play it once, possibly twice, and it is short, but in that short time cements Sachi in the reader's hearts.

I first became interested in this game because of its somewhat unique visual style and I thought the love interest was cute. When I first started I was worried that it would be a story that was really focused on pity as the foundation of a relationship, but I was very pleasantly surprised with what it turned out to be. It was a very beautiful story and it gives me hope.
It is a straight up visual novel with no dialogue branches, which I don't mind. However, it has multiple shifts in perspective, which I really, really enjoyed and gave the game a little more depth. If you think that it looks interesting at all, go for it. You won't be disappointed.

17622276.review:
I'm not really understanding all the negative comments about the price point for this game.  I spend $10 on a volume of manga and get about the same amount of content as this game gave me; except this game was one complete package with a cute, although rushed, ending and little animation scenes that almost gave me a heart attack from diabetic shock.  Anyways.  Actual review.

As I said above, the novel is a complete package, although it does feel a bit rushed (which the author recognized and apologized for).  However, it is a very sweet and cute story about love between two very different people (except for their seemingly shared scar fetish... still don't get that).  It sadly doesn't touch on the WHYS or HOWS of Sachi's existence as a monoeye, mainly focusing on their relationship and the drama she faces in school from being bullied and at home.  But she's such a cute and endearing character that you don't even really mind that.  All in all, I think it's worth the $10 I spent on it, and I'm hoping that the author revists this character and this world that he's built for more novels, hopefully improving or re-releasing this game with more content, new routes, etc.

Please note, to fully appreciate the game.. you probably need to already have some sort of positive bias for anime waifus and monstergirls in general.  'Course.. if you're actually looking at this game in the store.. you probably do already, haha.

11/10, would feed omelettes again.
